problem.p: There are 10 points \(A,B,\ldots\) in a plane, no three on the same line.

ul.li: How many lines are determined by the points?
How many of these lines do not pass through \(A\) or \(B\)?
How many triangles are determined by the points?
How many of these triangles contain point \(A\)?
How many of these triangles contain the side \(AB\)?
